Welcome to DataProfiler’s documentation!¶

WorldPay DataProfiler¶

Task¶

class worldpay.Task(name: str, data: List[str], column: List[str], start_time: datetime.datetime, end_time: datetime.datetime, resolution: str)[source]¶

Task class is used to define the parameters of how a set of data should be analysed

classmethod create_task_from_dict(task_dict: dict)[source]¶

Constructor for producing a Task object from a dictionary :param task_dict: :return:

Processor¶

class worldpay.Processor(tasks: list)[source]¶

Processor class, takes a set of tasks, loads the relevant, runs analyses, takes care of saving and displaying data

static disp_analysis(fname: pathlib.Path)[source]¶

Takes analysis output saved by save_analysis and pops it up in a browser window :return:

static load_data_from_csv(task: worldpay.Task)[source]¶

Loads data from csv, if more than one sources are specified, attempts detedt an index on which to join them and returns a joined dataframe. :param task: :return:

process(tasks: List[worldpay.Task])[source]¶

Entry point for task processor, which executes analyses on a given list of tasks. For each task will create a figure instance, load the data, run the analysis, save and display results. :param tasks: :return:

static save_analysis(task: worldpay.Task, file_format: str = 'png')[source]¶

Save the output of the analysis as PDF/PNG :return:

Analysis¶

class worldpay.Analysis(task: worldpay.Task, data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, date_format='%d/%m/%Y')[source]¶

Analysis class, hosts the set of possible analyses

plot_counts_over_time_window(ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes)[source]¶

Plot the data in column bucketed by time period, E.g. no. of casualties in a day, week or month, between start_time and end_time. :param ax: matplotlib axes object :return:

plot_pareto(ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes)[source]¶

Generate a pareto plot of distribution of column data when grouped by time period. Eg. distribution of no. of casualties in a day/week/month :param ax: matplotlib axes object :return:

plot_table(ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes)[source]¶

Plot a table of descriptive statistical info. :param ax: matplotlib axes object :return:

run(axs: List[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes])[source]¶

Entry point for executing the analysis defined in self._task :param axs: matplotlib axes objects in which results are presented :return:

summary_statistics(null_val: float = -1)[source]¶

Calculate and return a set of basic statistics on data :param null_val: pass a value that defines the case for missing or null values :return: dict
